results.title: The Drive home
results.brief_description: Everyone wants to know how to find their perfect partner. A woman is driving home, listening to her car radio when the DJ announces a new theory on how to find your perfect partner. Only trouble is, the woman’s car is about to enter a tunnel. Will she ever discover the secret?
results.description: Everyone wants to know how to find their perfect partner. A woman is driving home, listening to her car radio when the DJ announces a new theory on how to find your perfect partner. Only trouble is, the woman’s car is about to enter a tunnel. Will she ever discover the secret?

results.title: The Darra dogs
results.brief_description: Haunted by the dogs of his childhood, Dennis Tupicoff tries to explain his feelings about dogs to his 4 year old daughter. Dennis and his brothers grew up in Darra, then an industrial suburb of Brisbane where every household seemed to have a dog. Some were friends who shared their lives and explorations while others were “hounds from hell” prowling though the neighbourhood. The Darra Dogs is a memorial to the mortal terrors of childhood, the sadness of death and loss and, of course, to the dogs themselves.

results.title: Ashputtle: or the mother's ghost
results.brief_description: A mother does what has to be done to help her daughter - even if it means returning from the grave. A retelling of a traditional folktale (Grimm’s ‘Ashputtle’ as reworked by Angela Carter). Ashputtle is an unloved, uncared for and barely human child until her dead mother rises from the grave to look after her. It is a beautifully cut-out animation that explores themes of identity, responsibility, disintegration and transformation, in a bold and vibrant visual style.

results.title: Duplicating and manuscript
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advanced Typing”.
Demonstrates the correct methods of making masters for duplicating machine use, correcting mistakes on a stencil, the use of the illuminated drawing board for tracing lines, making hectograph masters, correcting mistakes when using hectograph ribbon, or carbon, use of electromatic hectograph machine, use of various types of duplicating machines, and typing manuscripts with footnotes. Centering on a typewriter improving characters or marks that do not appear on the keyboard, and reading proof readers’ marks are also explained.

results.title: Short Cuts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advanced Typing”.
Stresses the importance of having good posture and of having equipment and materials arranged for maximum efficiency. Demonstrates how to use tab stops, tab bar and decimal tabulator key. Shows the handling of carbon packs, use of the pressure indicator; correct method for making erasures, insertion of missing words and letters, removal of extra words and letters, typing cards, envelopes and labels, drawing vertical and horizontal lines.

results.title: Learning to swim: the crawl stroke
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Demonstrates the simplest of all swimming styles, the crawl. Shows how to develop confidence, buoyancy, correct leg and arm action, correct breathing and co-ordination for the full movement.

results.title: Coal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Elementary account of Australia’s coal industry showing models of coal formations; the principal coal mining areas of Australia; views of Wollongong, Newcastle and Lithgow, centres of coal mining areas; open cut mining at Musellbrook; the uses to which coal is put and some of its principal by-products.

results.title: Hydro-electric power
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Describes the way in which moisture laden cloud becomes rain, and eventually a flowing river with perhaps a waterfall included in its course. The principles of hydro-electric power are explained and model maps are used to show a plan of the Snowy Mountains undertaking.

results.title: Water safety
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Although our main beaches are well patrolled by lifesavers, it is in the rivers and creeks, where we must rely on ourselves, that many drownings occur. The film shows many ways in which we can help ourselves in an emergency and suggests precautions to take before swimming in unknown places. Commentary by David Low.
